intro: Microlicia woodii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated, berry-like fruits. Microlicia woodii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and medicinal studies.
